backend/main.mo: Main ICP actor implementing user profile storage and project/workflow/task CRUD operations with role-based access control (user/admin permissions) using a MixinAuthorization pattern.
feature_evidence.json: Feature evidence report listing two features: fixing the frontend post-login profile creation flow and adding proper error surfacing in SetupPage.tsx and useQueries.ts.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: JSON document containing one-line summaries of all frontend source files, describing their roles in the chat app UI including hooks, pages, and components.
frontend/index.css: Global Tailwind CSS entry point defining OKLCH-based CSS custom properties for light and dark themes including colors, sidebar, and chart tokens.
frontend/index.html: Minimal HTML shell for the React app with a root div and module script entry point, titled 'ChatApp'.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Root React component that routes between LoginPage, SetupPage, and ChatPage based on authentication state and whether a user profile exists, using isFetched to prevent flash.
frontend/src/components/ChatHeader.tsx: App header component displaying the logo, a theme toggle button, and a user dropdown menu with sign-out, typed with the ChatUser interface.
frontend/src/components/ConversationList: Left sidebar component showing a searchable conversation list with skeleton loading, empty states, and a New Chat dialog for selecting users to message.
frontend/src/components/MessageThread.ts: React component that renders a chat message thread for a selected user, including grouped messages by date, a textarea input, and send-on-Enter functionality with error handling.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: Custom hook that creates and caches an ICP backend actor (authenticated or anonymous) using React Query, and invalidates dependent queries whenever the actor changes.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Provides an InternetIdentityProvider and useInternetIdentity hook for managing ICP Internet Identity authentication state, including login, logout, and identity persistence via AuthClient.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: Defines React Query hooks for fetching and mutating user profiles, chat users, conversations, and messages against the ICP backend actor, along with shared frontend chat types.
frontend/src/index.css: Global stylesheet that imports fonts, configures Tailwind, and defines CSS custom properties for light/dark theme tokens including chat-specific bubble and sidebar colors using OKLCH.
frontend/src/lib/utils.ts: Exports a single cn utility function that merges Tailwind class names using clsx and tailwind-merge.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Application entry point that mounts the React app wrapped with QueryClientProvider and InternetIdentityProvider.
frontend/src/pages/ChatPage.tsx: Top-level chat page component that manages selected conversation state and responsive mobile/desktop layout between the ConversationList sidebar and MessageThread main panel.
frontend/src/pages/LoginPage.tsx: Renders the login landing page with Internet Identity authentication, displaying app branding, feature highlights (private, fast, simple), and a sign-in button that triggers the login flow.
frontend/src/pages/SetupPage.tsx: Renders a first-time setup form where new users enter a display name (2â€“32 chars), validates input, calls the saveProfile mutation, and invokes onComplete on success.
frontend/src/utils/urlParams.ts: Provides utility functions for reading URL query parameters (supporting both regular and hash-based routing), persisting them to sessionStorage, and cleaning sensitive params from the URL hash.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind CSS configuration defining the design system: OKLCH-based color tokens, custom fonts (Inter, JetBrains Mono), extended border radii, box shadows, and keyframe animations, with typography, container-queries, and animate plugins.
project_state.json: Tracks the overall project state (version 7) for a one-on-one Internet Computer chat app, listing existing features, known issues (deployment failures, profile creation errors), and architectural notes about polling and Internet Identity auth.
